channel.title: java on Machine Code Never Lies
channel.description: Recent content in java on Machine Code Never Lies

item.title: Tasks
item.description: What Every serious programmer secretly craves to program todo applications. tasks quenches this burning desire. It is a command line tool to enable creating and keeping track of tasks that need to be done. Why The main reason for this project was to have a simple project that allowed some degree of experimentation with various Java-based technologies. In fact, it was the first project that I used Java 9 with (mm, Map.

item.title: Tables
item.description: What tables is a tool to build a table and print it to a terminal. It was extracted from tasks project, when printing a proper table proved to be more tricky than the actual project itself. Why There was no intention to write anything related to the tables when I started dabbling with tasks. However, once I started thinking about how to approach printing multiline tables to a terminal it quickly became clear that a few newlines here and there would not suffice.

item.title: Books CRUD
item.description: What The project is a simple proof of concept CRUD app. Why The main motivation for the app was to see what it feels like when half of the Spring’s magic is stripped away. And boy does the Spring project take care of a lot of things.
